alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 2:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from stationary thunderstorms. * WHERE...Portions of Carbon and Albany County in Wyoming including the Mullen Burn Scar. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in southern portions of the Mullen Burn Scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Elkhorn Creek and Pelton Creek. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Elkhorn Creek and Pelton Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Illinois Creek Campground, Six Mile Campground, Miller Lake Campground and Evans Creek Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
